text: McCandless is a township with home rule status in Allegheny County, Pennsylvania, United States. The population was 29,698 at the 2020 census. The town was named after a person, Wilson McCandless (June 19, 1810 â€“ June 30, 1882). He was a judge of the United States District Court for the Western District of Pennsylvania. ==References== Category:Townships in Allegheny County, Pennsylvania
title: McCandless, Pennsylvania
